column4: Anyone ever use Orbiter 2010 and would like to bring it to linux?
you can try running it under wine
its not the same, I've tried with multiple versions of wine, I've followed there directions at their forum. 5 fps is a no go
Then they insult linux asa crappy os and ubuntu as a distro, not in their forum but in their irc
yeah, 5 fps is rough.  Only options are to run win in a vm, or talk to the orbiter devs and get them to make a linux port
Its worth bring to linux and mac, but the creator is too busy in medical research
the addon developers are rude
I hate dual booting, I live in ubuntu
like I said, if you own a copy of a win version that orbiter will run on you can run it in a vm
with 3d acceleration?
, worth a try
Its a space sim
much better than celestia
the addon developers even rip off the motherlode and put there meshes and textures in there stuff
I found it looking for a way to build models for compiz 3dcubemodel
Where would I go to drum up support to clone, find other developers, for a clone for *nix
Orbitux
Tux Orbiter
anyother ideas before I go?
or stop mentioning it
sure
make a vat of coffee, mix it with a sixpack of redbull lock the door and start reverse-engineering
